headline: How to Prove You’re Middle Class
abstract: Black people expend daily energy to counteract racial stereotypes and get fair treatment.
lead_paragraph: When the front desk clerk at a Portland, Ore., hotel told Felicia Gonzales, a black woman, that guests were required to sign a two-page “no party” agreement in order to check in, she thought the request was so strange that she decided to sit in the lobby to see if white guests were asked to do the same. They weren’t.
